text: hi guys it's a loose for marketp

cake let's get started so the basis for
your candy cake is going to be these
guys these are pre-cut round polystyrene
or styrofoam cake dummies available at
most cake decorating shops they're
basically like a fake cake and I went
with a four inch a six inch and 8 inch
and a 10 inch for this cake but you guys
can decide how many layers you want just
make sure that you've got at least two
inches differentiation in size so you've
got enough room for all that candy I've
got a couple of toothpicks and I'm also
using just a knife and a spoon and of
course I've got a myriad of candy so
when you're choosing your candy you can

I've got Twizzlers here but I ended up

ropes you're also going to need some

need something to present your cake on
so I'm just using a regular cake board
which I've covered in a little bit of

cutting it to size and gluing it down a
little bit of white chocolate now on the
board and then you just want to start
stacking your tiers of cake and you're
just going to use white chocolate in
between each of the layers to stack them
so what you should end up with is a nice
Tower of straight polystyrene blocks on
some sort of a surface a cake board a

candies here because it's going to be
one of your bigger layers just take a
spoon or so of that melted white
chocolate you don't need too much pop it
on the back and use it just to stand the
candy up touching that polystyrene make
sure that you get a bunch of different

elements when you're working with
polystyrene the glue
actually eats into the polystyrene and
your candies just going to fall off so
stick with that white chocolate as a
really nice sort of an edible blue
alternative moving on out to your next
largest layer so I'm going to use one of
my larger candies again I got these cool
little trolley gummy pizzas and once
again a bit of white chocolate on the
back and I'm just positioning them all
the way around that second tier for my
next layer
I used fads and I love them because
they're different colors on each side so

and just stuck them alternating around
that next layer of the cake this white

you can kind of just use your hands to

now a tip for when you're buying your

to add a little bit of extra height to

Jolly Rancher candies
and then to fill over any more of the

sticking them onto the cake so you want
to glue end to end with white chocolate
to make one big long marshmallow rope
section so that completes your totally
over-the-top 48 no bake candy cake now
bear in mind that all of these candies

there is no problem with them touching
